member.name: M:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.AddValue(System.Double,System.Double,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: PID iterator, call this function every sample period to get the current controller output. setpoint and processValue should use the same units.
member.param: Timespan Since Last Iteration, Use Default Sample Period for First Call

member.name: M:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.ResetController
member.summary: Reset controller history effectively resetting the controller.

member.name: P:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.Kp
member.summary: Proportional Gain, consider resetting controller if this parameter is drastically changed.

member.name: P:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.Ki
member.summary: Integral Gain, consider resetting controller if this parameter is drastically changed.

member.name: P:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.Kd
member.summary: Derivative Gain, consider resetting controller if this parameter is drastically changed.

member.name: P:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.N
member.summary: Derivative filter coefficient. A smaller N for more filtering. A larger N for less filtering. Consider resetting controller if this parameter is drastically changed.

member.name: P:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.TsMin
member.summary: Minimum allowed sample period to avoid dividing by zero! The Ts value can be mistakenly set to too low of a value or zero on the first iteration. TsMin by default is set to 1 millisecond.

member.name: P:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.OutputUpperLimit
member.summary: Upper output limit of the controller. This should obviously be a numerically greater value than the lower output limit.

member.name: P:Exavision.Seasense.Core.Algorithm.Pid.OutputLowerLimit
member.summary: Lower output limit of the controller This should obviously be a numerically lesser value than the upper output limit.
